intro: Fagelia cana, commonly known as the white-flowered fagelia, is a species of flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Fagelia cana is often found in the southeastern United States, particularly in Georgia and Florida.
